thread.title: DreamWorks Animation Announces ‘Trolls 2’; Sets for April 10, 2020 | Variety
thread.title_full: DreamWorks Animation Announces ‘Trolls 2’; Sets for April 10, 2020 | Variety

author: Justin Kroll
title: DreamWorks Animation Announces ‘Trolls 2’; Sets for April 10, 2020 | Variety
text:
Courtesy of Dreamworks February 28, 2017 | 10:57AM PT 
Following the success of the first film, Universal DreamWorks Animation has announced its plans for a sequel to “Trolls” and set a release date of April 10, 2020. 
Anna Kendrick and Justin Timberlake reprise their roles as the eternal optimist Poppy and the curmudgeon Branch in the new musical comedy-adventure from the creators of “Shrek.” Related Watch Now: Facebook Live Q&A With Justin Timberlake on Making the Oscar-Nominated Original Song From ‘Trolls’ 
“Trolls” went on to make $339 million worldwide. “Can’t Stop the Feeling” landed an Oscar nomination for best song, which Justin Timberlake performed as the opening number at this year’s Oscars . 
Universal Pictures will take over as distributor following its recent distribution deal with DWA after Fox distributed the first film. Mike Mitchell returns to direct. 
The first film follows Poppy, the happiest Troll ever born, and the curmudgeonly Branch set off on a journey to rescue her friends after the Bergens invade Troll Village. 
Watch the “Can’t Stop the Feeling” video below. Filed Under:
